Package ca.team4308.absolutelib.math

Class ChineseRemainderSolver

java.lang.Object
ca.team4308.absolutelib.math.ChineseRemainderSolver
public final class ChineseRemainderSolver extends Object
Generic Chinese Remainder Theorem (CRT) solver with turret anti-windup utilities.

The CRT finds a value x that simultaneously satisfies multiple modular congruences of the form x ≡ rᵢ (mod mᵢ). This is useful in FRC for:

  • Turret anti-windup: finding the shortest rotation to a target heading that lands on a valid encoder tick boundary without exceeding cable limits.
  • Discrete shot snapping: mapping continuous RPM/angle solutions to achievable hardware step values.
  • Gear-ratio alignment: finding positions where multiple geared axes align simultaneously.

Turret Anti-Windup Example


 // Turret: 4096 ticks/rev, currently at tick 1200, target heading = 270°
 // Cable limit: ±1.5 rotations (±6144 ticks from home)
 double targetDegrees = 270.0;
 double currentTicks = 1200;
 int ticksPerRev = 4096;

 double targetTick = ChineseRemainderSolver.degreesToTicks(targetDegrees, ticksPerRev);
 double shortestMove = ChineseRemainderSolver.shortestWrappedMove(currentTicks, targetTick, ticksPerRev);
 double destination = currentTicks + shortestMove;

 // Clamp to cable limits
 double safeDest = ChineseRemainderSolver.clampToWindupLimits(
         currentTicks, targetTick, ticksPerRev, -6144, 6144);

    • solvePair

      public static long[] solvePair(long a1, long m1, long a2, long m2)
      Solves two congruences: x ≡ a1 (mod m1) and x ≡ a2 (mod m2).
      Returns:
      [solution, lcm] or null if no solution exists (i.e., gcd(m1,m2) does not divide a2−a1)

    • solve

      public static ChineseRemainderSolver.Solution solve(List<ChineseRemainderSolver.Constraint> constraints)
      Solves a system of modular constraints using iterative pairwise CRT.
      Parameters:
      constraints - the constraints to satisfy simultaneously
      Returns:
      the combined solution, or null if the system is inconsistent

      Parameters:
      value - the value to test
      constraints - constraints to check
      Returns:
      true if every constraint is satisfied

      Returns:

    • shortestWrappedMove

      public static double shortestWrappedMove(double currentTicks, double targetTick, int ticksPerRev)
      Computes the shortest signed move (in ticks) from the current position to the target tick, wrapping around one revolution.

      Returns a value in (-ticksPerRev/2, ticksPerRev/2], representing the shortest-path direction. Positive = clockwise, negative = counter-clockwise (or vice versa depending on encoder convention).

      Parameters:
      currentTicks - current encoder position
      targetTick - desired encoder position (mod one revolution)
      ticksPerRev - ticks per full revolution
      Returns:
      shortest signed move in ticks

    • clampToWindupLimits

      public static double clampToWindupLimits(double currentTicks, double targetTick, int ticksPerRev, double minTicks, double maxTicks)
      Finds the destination tick closest to the current position that corresponds to the target heading, while staying within absolute windup limits.

      This is the primary anti-windup method. It enumerates all equivalent positions for the target heading (spaced one revolution apart) and picks the one closest to the current position that doesn't exceed the cable limits.

      If no in-bounds solution exists, returns the clamped limit in the direction of the shortest move.

      Parameters:
      currentTicks - current absolute encoder position
      targetTick - target position modulo one revolution (0 to ticksPerRev)
      ticksPerRev - ticks per full revolution
      minTicks - minimum absolute tick limit (negative = CCW limit)
      maxTicks - maximum absolute tick limit (positive = CW limit)
      Returns:
      the safe destination tick

    • safeTurretDestination

      public static double safeTurretDestination(double currentTicks, double targetDegrees, int ticksPerRev, double minTicks, double maxTicks)
      Convenience method: given a target heading in degrees and current absolute tick position, returns the safe destination tick.
      Parameters:
      currentTicks - current absolute encoder position
      targetDegrees - desired heading in degrees
      ticksPerRev - ticks per full revolution
      minTicks - minimum absolute tick limit
      maxTicks - maximum absolute tick limit
      Returns:
      safe destination tick within cable limits

    • snapToResolution

      public static double snapToResolution(double value, double resolution)
      Snaps a continuous value to the nearest discrete step. Useful for rounding RPM/angle to hardware-achievable values.
      Parameters:
      value - the continuous value
      resolution - the step size (e.g., 1.0 RPM, 0.1°)
      Returns:
      the nearest multiple of resolution

    • extendedGcd

      public static long[] extendedGcd(long a, long b)
      Extended Euclidean algorithm. Returns [gcd, x, y] such that a*x + b*y = gcd(a,b).
      Parameters:
      a - first value
      b - second value
      Returns:
      array [gcd, x, y]
